titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Communications Workers of America, Local 1151 Records WAG.244
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Adam Schafenberg, 2006

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from cwa local 1151.doc

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-03-29T22:43-0400

did.unittitle: Communications Workers of America, Local 1151 Records
did.abstract: Communications Workers of America, Local 1151 represented AT&T and Bell System employees in the Albany, NY area. The Local had its historical roots in the founding period of the CWA, and a strong tradition of involvement in the CWA's national activities, based on the involvement of its long-time president Frank Karl. In addition to his service to the Local, Karl was a long-standing member of CWA's National Bargaining Committee. Not long before the donation of the records to the Archives, Local 1151 merged with the CWA's local in Syracuse, New York.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Donated by former local president Frank Karl and Secretary-Treasurer John Schaeffer in April 2005.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Communications Workers of America, Local 1151 was chartered in 1951, to represent American Telephone & Telegraph's Long Lines (long distance) employees working in the Albany area. Local 1151 had its roots in the old Communications Workers of America (CWA) Division system, as Local 9 of Division No. 10.

Local 1151 was ably led by its long-time president, Francis (Frank) Karl. First elected in 1958, Karl would serve in this post for thrity-three years. In addition to his duties with the Local, President Karl performed service to the CWA international union by serving on the National Bargaining Committee, helping the union to negotiate six consecutive contracts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Series I: Minutes, consists of the minutes of Executive Board, General Membership, and Stewards meetings.
Series II: Correspondence, contains the internal correspondence of the Local, as well as correspondence exchanged with AT&T and other CWA organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are grouped into three series:

userestrict.p:

New York, NY 10012

prefercite.p:

Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number;

New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
